content.description:
Yoga With Tina is a fun route with quality stone most of the way. This starts with an easier pull, then it leads into a thin section that eventually traverses left into the shallow, right-facing dihedral. Techy moves get you to the small roof pull and a fixed draw.

Mantel up, and cruise buckets to the chains.

*The anchors for this route are in a rather inconvenient/hard-to-clip location. It's worth putting a draw on them to clip.
content.location: Locate the right-facing, shallow dihedral on the upper left side of the cliff. It is characterized by the lone fixed draw above the roof pull.

content.description:
Hoptimize is an awesome route in the center of the wall. Begin with an aggressive/steep boulder problem (probably around V3), and then cruise up easy but technical 5.10 terrain until reaching the small roof section.

Stem and tech your way up the roof through an awesome series of moves to the chains.

This is a classic for the area!
content.location:
Just right of "

Yoga With Tina

," identify the roof feature and shallow, right facing dihedral leaning into it.

content.description:
Blue Anteater has quality stone and technical movement. It starts with a few bolts on dirtier rock, then it ascends a panel of orange rock with surprising, horizontal crimps bars.

Knot your ends when lowering. A

70m rope is required.
content.location: Blue Anteater is the rightmost line at the cliff. It is the first full length pitch you come across from the approach trail.
